00055 template<class T> struct shared_ptr_traits
00056 {
00057     typedef T & reference;
00058 };
00059 
00060 template<> struct shared_ptr_traits<void>
00061 {
00062     typedef void reference;
00063 };

00068 {
00069     typedef void reference;

00073 {
00074     typedef void reference;

00078 {
00079     typedef void reference;

00084 // enable_shared_from_this support
00085 
00086 template<class T, class Y> void sp_enable_shared_from_this(boost::enable_shared_from_this<T> * pe, Y * px, shared_count const & pn)
00087 {
00088     if(pe != 0) pe->_internal_weak_this._internal_assign(px, pn);
00089 }
00090 
00091 inline void sp_enable_shared_from_this(void const volatile *, void const volatile *, shared_count const &)
00092 {
00093 }
00094 
00095 } // namespace detail
00096 
00097 
00098 //
00099 //  shared_ptr
00100 //
00101 //  An enhanced relative of scoped_ptr with reference counted copy semantics.
00102 //  The object pointed to is deleted when the last shared_ptr pointing to it
00103 //  is destroyed or reset.
00104 //
00105 
00106 template<class T> class shared_ptr
00107 {
00108 private:
00109 
00110     // Borland 5.5.1 specific workaround
00111     typedef shared_ptr<T> this_type;
00112 
00113 public:
00114 
00115     typedef T element_type;
00116     typedef T value_type;
00117     typedef T * pointer;
00118     typedef typename detail::shared_ptr_traits<T>::reference reference;
00119 
00120     shared_ptr(): px(0), pn() // never throws in 1.30+
00121     {
00122     }
00123 
00124     template<class Y>
00125     explicit shared_ptr(Y * p): px(p), pn(p, checked_deleter<Y>()) // Y must be complete
00126     {
00127         detail::sp_enable_shared_from_this(p, p, pn);
00128     }
00129 
00130     //
00131     // Requirements: D's copy constructor must not throw
00132     //
00133     // shared_ptr will release p by calling d(p)
00134     //
00135 
00136     template<class Y, class D> shared_ptr(Y * p, D d): px(p), pn(p, d)
00137     {
00138         detail::sp_enable_shared_from_this(p, p, pn);
00139     }
00140 
00141 //  generated copy constructor, assignment, destructor are fine...
00142 
00143 //  except that Borland C++ has a bug, and g++ with -Wsynth warns
00144 #if defined(__BORLANDC__) || defined(__GNUC__)
00145 
00146     shared_ptr & operator=(shared_ptr const & r) // never throws
00147     {
00148         px = r.px;
00149         pn = r.pn; // shared_count::op= doesn't throw
00150         return *this;
00151     }
00152 
00153 #endif
00154 
00155     template<class Y>
00156     explicit shared_ptr(weak_ptr<Y> const & r): pn(r.pn) // may throw
00157     {
00158         // it is now safe to copy r.px, as pn(r.pn) did not throw
00159         px = r.px;
00160     }
00161 
00162     template<class Y>
00163     shared_ptr(shared_ptr<Y> const & r): px(r.px), pn(r.pn) // never throws
00164     {
00165     }
00166 
00167     template<class Y>
00168     shared_ptr(shared_ptr<Y> const & r, detail::static_cast_tag): px(static_cast<element_type *>(r.px)), pn(r.pn)
00169     {
00170     }
00171 
00172     template<class Y>
00173     shared_ptr(shared_ptr<Y> const & r, detail::const_cast_tag): px(const_cast<element_type *>(r.px)), pn(r.pn)
00174     {
00175     }
00176 
00177     template<class Y>
00178     shared_ptr(shared_ptr<Y> const & r, detail::dynamic_cast_tag): px(dynamic_cast<element_type *>(r.px)), pn(r.pn)
00179     {
00180         if(px == 0) // need to allocate new counter -- the cast failed
00181         {
00182             pn = detail::shared_count();
00183         }
00184     }
00185 
00186     template<class Y>
00187     shared_ptr(shared_ptr<Y> const & r, detail::polymorphic_cast_tag): px(dynamic_cast<element_type *>(r.px)), pn(r.pn)
00188     {
00189         if(px == 0)
00190         {
00191             boost::throw_exception(std::bad_cast());
00192         }
00193     }
00194 
00195 #ifndef BOOST_NO_AUTO_PTR
00196 
00197     template<class Y>
00198     explicit shared_ptr(std::auto_ptr<Y> & r): px(r.get()), pn()
00199     {
00200         Y * tmp = r.get();
00201         pn = detail::shared_count(r);
00202         detail::sp_enable_shared_from_this(tmp, tmp, pn);
00203     }
00204 
00205 #endif
00206 
00207 #if !defined(BOOST_MSVC) || (BOOST_MSVC > 1200)
00208 
00209     template<class Y>
00210     shared_ptr & operator=(shared_ptr<Y> const & r) // never throws
00211     {
00212         px = r.px;
00213         pn = r.pn; // shared_count::op= doesn't throw
00214         return *this;
00215     }
00216 
00217 #endif
00218 
00219 #ifndef BOOST_NO_AUTO_PTR
00220 
00221     template<class Y>
00222     shared_ptr & operator=(std::auto_ptr<Y> & r)
00223     {
00224         this_type(r).swap(*this);
00225         return *this;
00226     }
00227 
00228 #endif
00229 
00230     void reset() // never throws in 1.30+
00231     {
00232         this_type().swap(*this);
00233     }
00234 
00235     template<class Y> void reset(Y * p) // Y must be complete
00236     {
00237         BOOST_ASSERT(p == 0 || p != px); // catch self-reset errors
00238         this_type(p).swap(*this);
00239     }
00240 
00241     template<class Y, class D> void reset(Y * p, D d)
00242     {
00243         this_type(p, d).swap(*this);
00244     }
00245 
00246     reference operator* () const // never throws
00247     {
00248         BOOST_ASSERT(px != 0);
00249         return *px;
00250     }
00251 
00252     T * operator-> () const // never throws
00253     {
00254         BOOST_ASSERT(px != 0);
00255         return px;
00256     }
00257     
00258     T * get() const // never throws
00259     {
00260         return px;
00261     }
00262 
00263     // implicit conversion to "bool"
00264 
00265 #if defined(__SUNPRO_CC) && BOOST_WORKAROUND(__SUNPRO_CC, <= 0x530)
00266 
00267     operator bool () const
00268     {
00269         return px != 0;
00270     }
00271 
00272 #elif defined(__MWERKS__) && BOOST_WORKAROUND(__MWERKS__, BOOST_TESTED_AT(0x3003))
00273     typedef T * (this_type::*unspecified_bool_type)() const;
00274     
00275     operator unspecified_bool_type() const // never throws
00276     {
00277         return px == 0? 0: &this_type::get;
00278     }
00279 
00280 #else 
00281 
00282     typedef T * this_type::*unspecified_bool_type;
00283 
00284     operator unspecified_bool_type() const // never throws
00285     {
00286         return px == 0? 0: &this_type::px;
00287     }
00288 
00289 #endif
00290 
00291     // operator! is redundant, but some compilers need it
00292 
00293     bool operator! () const // never throws
00294     {
00295         return px == 0;
00296     }
00297 
00298     bool unique() const // never throws
00299     {
00300         return pn.unique();
00301     }
00302 
00303     long use_count() const // never throws
00304     {
00305         return pn.use_count();
00306     }
00307 
00308     void swap(shared_ptr<T> & other) // never throws
00309     {
00310         std::swap(px, other.px);
00311         pn.swap(other.pn);
00312     }
00313 
00314     template<class Y> bool _internal_less(shared_ptr<Y> const & rhs) const
00315     {
00316         return pn < rhs.pn;
00317     }
00318 
00319     void * _internal_get_deleter(std::type_info const & ti) const
00320     {
00321         return pn.get_deleter(ti);
00322     }
00323 
00324 // Tasteless as this may seem, making all members public allows member templates
00325 // to work in the absence of member template friends. (Matthew Langston)
00326 
00327 #ifndef BOOST_NO_MEMBER_TEMPLATE_FRIENDS
00328 
00329 private:
00330 
00331     template<class Y> friend class shared_ptr;
00332     template<class Y> friend class weak_ptr;
00333 
00334 
00335 #endif
00336 
00337     T * px;                     // contained pointer
00338     detail::shared_count pn;    // reference counter
00339 
00340 };  // shared_ptr
00341 
00342 template<class T, class U> inline bool operator==(shared_ptr<T> const & a, shared_ptr<U> const & b)
00343 {
00344     return a.get() == b.get();
00345 }
00346 
00347 template<class T, class U> inline bool operator!=(shared_ptr<T> const & a, shared_ptr<U> const & b)
00348 {
00349     return a.get() != b.get();
00350 }
00351 
00352 #if __GNUC__ == 2 && __GNUC_MINOR__ <= 96
00353 
00354 // Resolve the ambiguity between our op!= and the one in rel_ops
00355 
00356 template<class T> inline bool operator!=(shared_ptr<T> const & a, shared_ptr<T> const & b)
00357 {
00358     return a.get() != b.get();
00359 }
00360 
00361 #endif
00362 
00363 template<class T, class U> inline bool operator<(shared_ptr<T> const & a, shared_ptr<U> const & b)
00364 {
00365     return a._internal_less(b);
00366 }
00367 
00368 template<class T> inline void swap(shared_ptr<T> & a, shared_ptr<T> & b)
00369 {
00370     a.swap(b);
00371 }
00372 
00373 template<class T, class U> shared_ptr<T> static_pointer_cast(shared_ptr<U> const & r)
00374 {
00375     return shared_ptr<T>(r, detail::static_cast_tag());
00376 }
00377 
00378 template<class T, class U> shared_ptr<T> const_pointer_cast(shared_ptr<U> const & r)
00379 {
00380     return shared_ptr<T>(r, detail::const_cast_tag());
00381 }
00382 
00383 template<class T, class U> shared_ptr<T> dynamic_pointer_cast(shared_ptr<U> const & r)
00384 {
00385     return shared_ptr<T>(r, detail::dynamic_cast_tag());
00386 }
00387 
00388 // shared_*_cast names are deprecated. Use *_pointer_cast instead.
00389 
00390 template<class T, class U> shared_ptr<T> shared_static_cast(shared_ptr<U> const & r)
00391 {
00392     return shared_ptr<T>(r, detail::static_cast_tag());
00393 }
00394 
00395 template<class T, class U> shared_ptr<T> shared_dynamic_cast(shared_ptr<U> const & r)
00396 {
00397     return shared_ptr<T>(r, detail::dynamic_cast_tag());
00398 }
00399 
00400 template<class T, class U> shared_ptr<T> shared_polymorphic_cast(shared_ptr<U> const & r)
00401 {
00402     return shared_ptr<T>(r, detail::polymorphic_cast_tag());
00403 }
00404 
00405 template<class T, class U> shared_ptr<T> shared_polymorphic_downcast(shared_ptr<U> const & r)
00406 {
00407     BOOST_ASSERT(dynamic_cast<T *>(r.get()) == r.get());
00408     return shared_static_cast<T>(r);
00409 }
00410 
00411 // get_pointer() enables boost::mem_fn to recognize shared_ptr
00412 
00413 template<class T> inline T * get_pointer(shared_ptr<T> const & p)
00414 {
00415     return p.get();
00416 }

00421 
00422 template<class Y> std::ostream & operator<< (std::ostream & os, shared_ptr<Y> const & p)
00423 {
00424     os << p.get();
00425     return os;
00426 }
00427 
00428 #else
00429 
00430 # if defined(BOOST_MSVC) && BOOST_WORKAROUND(BOOST_MSVC, <= 1200 && __SGI_STL_PORT)
00431 // MSVC6 has problems finding std::basic_ostream through the using declaration in namespace _STL
00432 using std::basic_ostream;
00433 template<class E, class T, class Y> basic_ostream<E, T> & operator<< (basic_ostream<E, T> & os, shared_ptr<Y> const & p)
00434 # else
00435 template<class E, class T, class Y> std::basic_ostream<E, T> & operator<< (std::basic_ostream<E, T> & os, shared_ptr<Y> const & p)
00436 # endif 
00437 {
00438     os << p.get();
00439     return os;
00440 }
00441 
00442 #endif

00444 // get_deleter (experimental)
00445 
00446 #if (defined(__GNUC__) &&  (__GNUC__ < 3)) || (defined(__EDG_VERSION__) && (__EDG_VERSION__ <= 238))
00447 
00448 // g++ 2.9x doesn't allow static_cast<X const *>(void *)
00449 // apparently EDG 2.38 also doesn't accept it
00450 
00451 template<class D, class T> D * get_deleter(shared_ptr<T> const & p)
00452 {
00453     void const * q = p._internal_get_deleter(typeid(D));
00454     return const_cast<D *>(static_cast<D const *>(q));
00455 }
00456 
00457 #else
00458 
00459 template<class D, class T> D * get_deleter(shared_ptr<T> const & p)
00460 {
00461     return static_cast<D *>(p._internal_get_deleter(typeid(D)));
00462 }
00463 
00464 #endif
